page.title: 19Life Styles.
page.content: There are two contrasting life styles in the block; those residents from traditionally Aberdeenshire families engaged in agriculture in and around the block; and those who have entered the area since the early 1970's due to the advent of oil, who have purchased homes in the area but who commute to Aberdeen to work. Compared with the taciturn 'natives', the 'newcomers' have tended to seem vocal, articulate and confident, which has led to some polite estrangement between the two groups. However, such 'newcomers' have taken a keen interest in local affairs and have in many cases contributed greatly to organisations such as the local school Parent- Teacher Association.
